events.message: The customer reported an accident involving their car hitting a tree on the evening of April 30th.
Claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident based on the customer's description of the vehicle collision.
An agent was promptly assigned to handle the claim and contact the customer for further details on the car accident.
The customer received formal acknowledgement of their auto accident claim with reference number issued.
Request sent to the customer for police report, photos of the car damage, and repair estimates to proceed.
Customer provided the police report, images of the damaged vehicle, and an initial repair quotation.
Investigators began reviewing the submitted documents and contacted witnesses about the collision incident.
Investigation concluded confirming the customer's vehicle was damaged in a collision caused by a storm.
A settlement proposal based on repair costs and policy coverage was sent to the customer for review.
Customer responded positively, agreeing to the proposed settlement for the auto accident claim.
The claim was approved by management following confirmation of all documents and customer acceptance.
Payment was processed and transferred to the customer's bank for car repairs related to the accident.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after confirmation that repairs were completed satisfactorily.
All files and correspondence related to the claim were archived as per company policy for future reference.
